abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Public Resource
            Management and Governance Reform Development Policy Grant
            Project for Sao Tome and Principe were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory; risk to development outcome was moderate;
            Bank performance was satisfactory and borrower performance
            was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes:
            continued attention needs to be paid to changes in the
            external environment in all new operations; effective
            supervision will contribute to maintain the implementation
            pace of a reform program; an adequate institutional capacity
            building assessment is a key and necessary element for
            ensuring quality at entry; and continued emphasis on
            building an Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) culture will
            contribute to maintaining the implementation of an
            operation's commitments on track. These lessons are
            being reflected in arrangements for follow-up operations.
            They also have general applicability for similar operations
            in small island countries.
